messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the icu program, here is the asan report

The sanitizer detected a undefined behavior vulnerability. The explanation of the vulnerability is: The program exhibits undefined behavior, leading to unpredictable results or crashes. Here is the detail: 

runtime error: signed integer overflow: 1651667876 * 60 cannot be represented in type 'int'
    - icu_75::ChineseCalendar::handleGetExtendedYear(UErrorCode&) icu4c/source/i18n/chnsecal.cpp:236:22
    - icu_75::Calendar::handleComputeJulianDay(UCalendarDateFields, UErrorCode&) icu4c/source/i18n/calendar.cpp:3394:16
    - icu_75::Calendar::computeJulianDay(UErrorCode&) icu4c/source/i18n/calendar.cpp:3377:12
    - icu_75::Calendar::computeTime(UErrorCode&) icu4c/source/i18n/calendar.cpp:3117:25
    - icu_75::Calendar::updateTime(UErrorCode&) icu4c/source/i18n/calendar.cpp:4124:5
    - icu_75::Calendar::complete(UErrorCode&) icu4c/source/i18n/calendar.cpp:1342:9
    - icu_75::Calendar::get(UCalendarDateFields, UErrorCode&) const icu4c/source/i18n/calendar.cpp:1194:47
    - icu_75::Calendar::add(UCalendarDateFields, int, UErrorCode&) icu4c/source/i18n/calendar.cpp:2164:23
    - icu_75::ChineseCalendar::add(UCalendarDateFields, int, UErrorCode&) icu4c/source/i18n/chnsecal.cpp:391:19
    - main poc.cpp:32:8

SUMMARY: UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer: undefined-behavior .././icu4c/source/i18n/chnsecal.cpp:236:22 

To fix this issue, follow the advice below:

1. Review the code for undefined behavior patterns and correct them.
2. Check for type mismatches, signed integer overflows, and other undefined behavior triggers.


The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

message.name: viewcode
message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 211 to line 250 in icu4c/source/i18n/chnsecal.cpp: 211| } 212| 213| 214| //---------------------------------------------------------------------- 215| // Calendar framework 216| //---------------------------------------------------------------------- 217| 218| /** 219| * Implement abstract Calendar method to return the extended year 220| * defined by the current fields. This will use either the ERA and 221| * YEAR field as the cycle and year-of-cycle, or the EXTENDED_YEAR 222| * field as the continuous year count, depending on which is newer. 223| * @stable ICU 2.8 224| */ 225| int32_t ChineseCalendar::handleGetExtendedYear(UErrorCode& status) { 226| if (U_FAILURE(status)) { 227| return 0; 228| } 229| 230| int32_t year; 231| if (newestStamp(UCAL_ERA, UCAL_YEAR, kUnset) <= fStamp[UCAL_EXTENDED_YEAR]) { 232| year = internalGet(UCAL_EXTENDED_YEAR, 1); // Default to year 1 233| } else { 234| int32_t cycle = internalGet(UCAL_ERA, 1) - 1; // 0-based cycle 235| // adjust to the instance specific epoch 236| year = cycle * 60 + internalGet(UCAL_YEAR, 1) - (fEpochYear - CHINESE_EPOCH_YEAR); 237| } 238| return year; 239| } 240| 241| /** 242| * Override Calendar method to return the number of days in the given 243| * extended year and month. 244| * 245| *

Note: This method also reads the IS_LEAP_MONTH field to determine 246| * whether or not the given month is a leap month. 247| * @stable ICU 2.8 248| */ 249| int32_t ChineseCalendar::handleGetMonthLength(int32_t extendedYear, int32_t month) const { 250| int32_t thisStart = handleComputeMonthStart(extendedYear, month, true) - We think the following hints might be helpful: The line 236 in icu4c/source/i18n/chnsecal.cpp which appears in the stack trace is: year = cycle * 60 + internalGet(UCAL_YEAR, 1) - (fEpochYear - CHINESE_EPOCH_YEAR); Here are the definitions of the symbols in the line: 1. variable year Type: int32_t (aka int) // In ChineseCalendar::handleGetExtendedYear int32_t year 2. variable cycle Type: int32_t (aka int) 0-based cycle // In ChineseCalendar::handleGetExtendedYear int32_t cycle = this->internalGet(UCAL_ERA, 1) - 1 3. instance-method internalGet provided by "unicode/calendar.h" → int32_t (aka int) Parameters: - UCalendarDateFields field (aka UCalendarDateFields) - int32_t defaultValue (aka int) Gets the value for a given time field. Subclasses can use this function to get field values without forcing recomputation of time. If the field's stamp is UNSET, the defaultValue is used. @param field The given time field. @param defaultValue a default value used if the field is unset. @return The value for the given time field. @internal // In Calendar protected: inline int32_t internalGet(UCalendarDateFields field, int32_t defaultValue) const 4. enumerator UCAL_YEAR provided by "unicode/ucal.h" Type: enum UCalendarDateFields Value = 1 Passed as field Field number indicating the year. This is a calendar-specific value. @stable ICU 2.6 // In UCalendarDateFields UCAL_YEAR 5. field fEpochYear provided by "chnsecal.h" Type: int32_t (aka int) Start year of this Chinese calendar instance. // In ChineseCalendar private: int32_t fEpochYear 6. variable CHINESE_EPOCH_YEAR Type: const int32_t (aka const int) Value = -2636 (0xfffff5b4) Gregorian year static const int32_t CHINESE_EPOCH_YEAR = -2636

Here is the code snippet from line 232 to line 271 in icu4c/source/i18n/chnsecal.cpp: 232| year = internalGet(UCAL_EXTENDED_YEAR, 1); // Default to year 1 233| } else { 234| int32_t cycle = internalGet(UCAL_ERA, 1) - 1; // 0-based cycle 235| // adjust to the instance specific epoch 236| year = cycle * 60 + internalGet(UCAL_YEAR, 1) - (fEpochYear - CHINESE_EPOCH_YEAR); 237| } 238| return year; 239| } 240| 241| /** 242| * Override Calendar method to return the number of days in the given 243| * extended year and month. 244| * 245| *

Note: This method also reads the IS_LEAP_MONTH field to determine 246| * whether or not the given month is a leap month. 247| * @stable ICU 2.8 248| */ 249| int32_t ChineseCalendar::handleGetMonthLength(int32_t extendedYear, int32_t month) const { 250| int32_t thisStart = handleComputeMonthStart(extendedYear, month, true) - 251| kEpochStartAsJulianDay + 1; // Julian day -> local days 252| int32_t nextStart = newMoonNear(thisStart + SYNODIC_GAP, true); 253| return nextStart - thisStart; 254| } 255| 256| /** 257| * Override Calendar to compute several fields specific to the Chinese 258| * calendar system. These are: 259| * 260| *

  • ERA 261| *
  • YEAR 262| *
  • MONTH 263| *
  • DAY_OF_MONTH 264| *
  • DAY_OF_YEAR 265| *
  • EXTENDED_YEAR
266| * 267| * The DAY_OF_WEEK and DOW_LOCAL fields are already set when this 268| * method is called. The getGregorianXxx() methods return Gregorian 269| * calendar equivalents for the given Julian day. 270| * 271| *

Compute the ChineseCalendar-specific field IS_LEAP_MONTH. We think the following hints might be helpful: The line 236 in icu4c/source/i18n/chnsecal.cpp which appears in the stack trace is: year = cycle * 60 + internalGet(UCAL_YEAR, 1) - (fEpochYear - CHINESE_EPOCH_YEAR); Here are the definitions of the symbols in the line: 1. variable year Type: int32_t (aka int) // In ChineseCalendar::handleGetExtendedYear int32_t year 2. variable cycle Type: int32_t (aka int) 0-based cycle // In ChineseCalendar::handleGetExtendedYear int32_t cycle = this->internalGet(UCAL_ERA, 1) - 1 3. instance-method internalGet provided by "unicode/calendar.h" → int32_t (aka int) Parameters: - UCalendarDateFields field (aka UCalendarDateFields) - int32_t defaultValue (aka int) Gets the value for a given time field. Subclasses can use this function to get field values without forcing recomputation of time. If the field's stamp is UNSET, the defaultValue is used. @param field The given time field. @param defaultValue a default value used if the field is unset. @return The value for the given time field. @internal // In Calendar protected: inline int32_t internalGet(UCalendarDateFields field, int32_t defaultValue) const 4. enumerator UCAL_YEAR provided by "unicode/ucal.h" Type: enum UCalendarDateFields Value = 1 Passed as field Field number indicating the year. This is a calendar-specific value. @stable ICU 2.6 // In UCalendarDateFields UCAL_YEAR 5. field fEpochYear provided by "chnsecal.h" Type: int32_t (aka int) Start year of this Chinese calendar instance. // In ChineseCalendar private: int32_t fEpochYear 6. variable CHINESE_EPOCH_YEAR Type: const int32_t (aka const int) Value = -2636 (0xfffff5b4) Gregorian year static const int32_t CHINESE_EPOCH_YEAR = -2636

56| // --- The cache --
57| static icu::UMutex astroLock;
58| static icu::CalendarAstronomer *gChineseCalendarAstro = nullptr;
59| 
60| // Lazy Creation & Access synchronized by class CalendarCache with a mutex.
61| static icu::CalendarCache *gChineseCalendarWinterSolsticeCache = nullptr;
62| static icu::CalendarCache *gChineseCalendarNewYearCache = nullptr;
63| 
64| static icu::TimeZone *gChineseCalendarZoneAstroCalc = nullptr;
65| static icu::UInitOnce gChineseCalendarZoneAstroCalcInitOnce {};
66| 
67| /**
68|  * The start year of the Chinese calendar, the 61st year of the reign
69|  * of Huang Di.  Some sources use the first year of his reign,
70|  * resulting in EXTENDED_YEAR values 60 years greater and ERA (cycle)
71|  * values one greater.
72|  */
73| static const int32_t CHINESE_EPOCH_YEAR = -2636; // Gregorian year
74| 
75| /**
76|  * The offset from GMT in milliseconds at which we perform astronomical
77|  * computations.  Some sources use a different historically accurate
78|  * offset of GMT+7:45:40 for years before 1929; we do not do this.
79|  */
80| static const int32_t CHINA_OFFSET = 8 * kOneHour;
81| 
82| /**
83|  * Value to be added or subtracted from the local days of a new moon to
84|  * get close to the next or prior new moon, but not cross it.  Must be
85|  * >= 1 and < CalendarAstronomer.SYNODIC_MONTH.
86|  */
87| static const int32_t SYNODIC_GAP = 25;
88| 
89| 
90| U_CDECL_BEGIN
